intro: Oenothera deltoides var. piperi, commonly known as the desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its yellow, tubular flowers that open in the evening. The plant has hairy, linear leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dark seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. The species is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient plant in desert ecosystems.
